title: Injury Update: Gary Payton II (illness) ruled out for Game 7 vs. Rockets
description: The Warriors will be without Gary Payton II for Game 7 against the Rockets on Sunday due to an illness.
excerpt: The Warriors will be without Gary Payton II for Game 7 against the Rockets on Sunday due to an illness.
text: Speaking pregame, Warriors head coach Steve Kerr said Gary Payton II -- out with an illness -- is "sick as a dog." Woke up unwell and hasn't eaten. html:
Speaking pregame, Warriors head coach Steve Kerr said Gary Payton II -- out with an illness -- is "sick as a dog." Woke up unwell and hasn't eaten. "No way he can play," Kerr said, noting Golden State has to "mix and match" without him.

— Sam Gordon (@BySamGordon) May 4, 2025

Prior to the start of Game 6, Gary Payton II entered the starting lineup for the first time in the Golden State Warriors' opening-round series against the Houston Rockets. Fast forward to Game 7, the Warriors will be without their newly-crowned starter on Sunday in Houston.

After being listed as questionable on Sunday with an illness, Payton II was officially ruled out for Game 7 against the Rockets. Payton II becomes the third player to be listed with an illness designation against the Rockets. Brandin Podziemski and Jonathan Kuminga also dealt with illnesses in the first round of the postseason against the Rockets.

With Payton II sidelined, the Warriors will have the option to start Brandin Podziemski or Moses Moody alongside Steph Curry, Jimmy Butler, Draymond Green and Buddy Hield. Payton II's absence could also open up minutes for Jonathan Kuminga off the bench.

The Warriors and Rockets will meet for a pivotal win-or-go-home Game 7 on Sunday at 5:30 p.m. PT.

This post originally appeared on Warriors Wire! Follow us on Facebook and Twitter!
